image.altText: A fish hotel made of wood and rocks in the bend of a slow-moving freshwater river.

props.synopsis: This spring offers a critical window to see if man-made "bungalows" installed in rivers can help a struggling fish species. If they work, they could provide a path forward for restoring other battling Australian freshwater fish populations.

title.children: How ecologists turned fish 'hotels' into 'bungalows' to save a species

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a couch looking down at an image of a smiling young man with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: After Canberra woman Leesa Mountford's son, Josh Clarke, took his own life at 25, she co-founded grassroots support network I Got You — helping to fill a gap with demand for support services skyrocketing in the past two years.

title.children: After Josh took his life, his mum started a support network in his honour

image.altText: A man and woman sit on a ute with a dog and a load of hay.

props.synopsis: Operating a pub is no mean feat, but try doing it while running a farm at the same time. That is exactly what farmers Karen and Rowan Alcock have done in their town of Bemboka on the New South Wales far south coast.

title.children: Farmers buy local pub to help foster connection in country town

image.altText: Netball9

props.synopsis: Before they take the court, the Magnolias strap on knee braces and tie bows in their hair. But don't be deceived, they're playing one of the 'most competitive games', and there may be elbows thrown.

title.children: Knee braces are the norm in this competitive sport adaptation

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses and a dark blue suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Josh Fenwick, 29, is found guilty of raping a 16-year-old girl he took home from Civic with her friend after a night out drinking.

title.children: Canberra man found guilty of raping teen as co-accused's charge dismissed

image.altText: Wide shot of men and boys on rocks carrying surfboard down to the beach, one surfboard has Aboriginal flag painted on it

props.synopsis: It started with a surf lesson, but these these Indigenous teens found something far deeper in the ocean.

title.children: How surf lessons helped Indigenous teenagers find a connection to country

image.altText: a red missile head poking out from underneath a sheet while two workers in white lab outfits work on the missile

props.synopsis: Russia says the 9M730 Burevestnik "Storm Petrel" is "invincible" to current and future missile defences, with an almost unlimited range and unpredictable flight path.

title.children: Putin says Russia has a new missile 'nobody else in the world has'

image.altText: An F/A-18F Super Hornet aircraft landing on a us navy carrier ship

props.synopsis: Both aircraft went down while conducting "routine operations", the US Navy said, adding that five personnel were "safe and in stable condition" after the crashes.

title.children: Two US Navy aircraft crash within 30 minutes in South China Sea

image.altText: Facebook smartphone app icon GOOD GENERIC

props.synopsis: Right now, more than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can apply for a slice of a $50 million compensation fund from tech giant Meta — the largest ever payment for a breach of Australians' privacy.

title.children: More than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can claim in this $50m payout

image.altText: A basket lift outside the Louvre museum.

props.synopsis: What do we know about the investigation into the jewel heist at the Louvre and what are some of the possible consequences?

title.children: Could the theft of gold and jewels from the Louvre have a silver lining?

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in Question Time.

props.synopsis: The Coalition pressures the government in Question Time over the effectiveness of the CFMEU administrator and calls on Labor to deregister the organisation. Take a look back at the day's coverage here.

title.children: Coalition targets Labor over CFMEU amid Question Time giggles — as it happened

image.altText: A middle-aged woman, smiling

props.synopsis: The 68-year-old former barrister is known for being one of the leading pro-Palestinian voices in the Irish parliament.

title.children: Ireland's left-leaning independent proves popular with young people after landslide election victory

image.altText: Australian Dollar coins and notes generic

props.synopsis: Top Chinese and American officials have held "constructive" talks ahead of a meeting between Trump and Xi. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar jumps on 'very successful' US-China deal framework

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX gains on US/China trade hopes, rare earths dumped
Equity Trustees says it's considering asking government to pay First Guardian investors
The 'hyperscale' AI giants are spending a fortune on cap-ex, is it worth it?

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Loved ones of Victorian woman Hannah McGuire looked on with shock as a prosecutor told the Supreme Court of her 2024 murder and the events leading up to it.

title.children: Courtroom filled with disgust for Hannah McGuire's killer, Lachlan Young

image.altText: F1 driver sitting on a stool in the pit lane after winning and F1 race

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has lost his lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship. Despite momentum working against the Australian, there are still plenty of reasons to believe he can win the world title.

title.children: Piastri's lead is gone, but there is hope in his bid for the F1 title

image.altText: Little Zak's Academy in Doonside

props.synopsis: It comes after two female workers were accused of allegedly assaulting a toddler multiple times earlier this month.

title.children: Sydney childcare centre closes after two workers charged with assault

image.altText: a small group in a crowd holding signs

props.synopsis: After months of negotiations and a historic teacher strike, the government has made a pay offer to Queensland's state school teachers which they have until Friday to vote on.

title.children: Queensland teachers offered minimum $100k per year under proposed pay deal

image.altText: peg stands against brick wall holding her phone

props.synopsis: Data from the latest HILDA survey indicates socialising rates have dropped over the past two decades, and, more recently, have not returned to pre-COVID frequency.

title.children: We are socialising less and loneliness is rising. Here is what can help

image.altText: A man on a bike rides past a crash scene

props.synopsis: A woman is critically injured when two cars smash into an office building in Perth's central business district, causing traffic havoc during peak hour on Monday morning.

title.children: Witnesses rush to help as crash leaves two cars 'stuck' in front of building

image.altText: Picture of the back of a man in a dark-blue rain jacket with RESCUE on the back staring over the ocean towards the beach.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching a vast stretch of the Mid North Coast where the man was seen losing altitude on Sunday.

title.children: Search underway for hang-glider who disappeared near NSW beach

image.altText: A tree fallen on a fence.

props.synopsis: Some residents have recounted seeing family members lifted off their feet as what the Bureau of Meteorology believes was a tornado swept through Melbourne's western suburbs on Sunday.

title.children: 'Like stuff out of a movie': Tornado believed to have hit Melbourne's west

image.altText: A scenic tropical beach seen from a lookout.

props.synopsis: Wildlife rangers investigate a crocodile attack on a teenage boy at a beach in far north Queensland.

title.children: Crocodile mauls boy, 14, at Cape Tribulation beach

image.altText: A  woman in a blue blazer walks past a TV camera

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has denied being involved in a leadership "coup" to remove the chief executive of the Central Land Council while giving evidence in the Federal Court.

title.children: Senator Nampijinpa Price denies involvement in land council leadership 'coup'

image.altText: A close up of the Booking.com app icon on the screen of a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Within minutes of requesting a refund for an unsavoury holiday stay, a Booking.com customer was hoodwinked into providing her bank details to a scam artist.

title.children: Tourist warns of online scam after brush with convincing fraudster

image.altText: Shopping trolley full of food items including broccoli florets, toothpaste and Brussels sprouts.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Agriculture says funds have run dry for its monthly food aid program, which more than 41 million Americans depend on to buy groceries.

title.children: US says no food aid benefits will be issued next month

image.altText: Vanuatu's Prime Minister Jotham Napat and Anthony Albanese shake hands.

props.synopsis: Australia has cemented its position as the Pacific's largest donor by far as other countries pull back on lending and prepare to cut back on foreign aid, according to the Lowy Institute.

title.children: Australia outpaces every nation including China in Pacific aid

image.altText: Donald Trump wears red cap word words visible: "America" and "again".

props.synopsis: To remind the US president: China is both communist and working passably well, something he and the United States generally are being forced reluctantly to confront.

title.children: Trump has a 'Sputnik moment' but China is wiping the floor with America

image.altText: Holly Rankin in a suit and sitting in a chair smiles, stainless steel pitcher next to her on a table, wood paneled wall.

props.synopsis: Labor has ruled out changing copyright laws to give tech giants free rein to train artificial intelligence models on creative works after the proposition was met with widespread backlash from artists.

title.children: Artists tell AI to 'solve the problem' as copyright carve-out ruled out

image.altText: A grainy photo of a grey-haired man wearing a turtle neck sweater and a suit jacket standing in a room in front of a door.

props.synopsis: Israeli spy agency Mossad publishes details about an alleged Iranian official it claims is responsible for leading a unit promoting antisemitic attacks around the world, including in Australia.

title.children: Israel names Iranian it says is responsible for attacks in Australia

image.altText: Person in a winter jacket looking at the flight board in the airport

props.synopsis: Readers share their challenges in getting flights refunded when booking through a third-party travel agent. We asked experts what that process should look like, what your rights are, and where to get additional support.

title.children: How to get a refund from your travel agent if flights cancelled or delayed

image.altText: Fuel pump covered in plastic at a gas station, four dogs sit on the forecourt.

props.synopsis: US forecasters believe the Category 4 hurricane could reach Category 5 status, unleashing torrential rain and threatening to cause catastrophic flooding in the northern Caribbean, including Haiti and Jamaica.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa strengthens as it approaches Jamaica

image.altText: A soldier in battle dress raises a device that resembles a large camera lens crossed with a traffic speed gun.

props.synopsis: As European countries rush to shore up their defences amid relentless fighting in Ukraine and a growing Russian "shadow" threat, companies here are capitalising on the age of drone warfare.

title.children: Drone terror in Europe sends Australian defence tech soaring

image.altText: Prince Andrew in ceremonial clothes looks out a rainy window

props.synopsis: It comes amid mounting speculation that King Charles III may force his younger brother out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle.

title.children: British MPs consider motion to strip Prince Andrew of royal titles
